title: Is it true that we always score more marks as that expected in the class 12 boards (PCM)? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. [It depends on how we estimate our marks] ° I used to think I'll score 90% in X examination (based on my performance in pre-board) but in reality I scored 6% less than that. However, many in my school performed very well and scored 90%+ though they used to get very less marks in school term examinations. [So, the thing is you have to have a strategy to score good marks in any examination, I used to study for gaining knowledge (for which, sometimes I receive appreciation and other times no applause at all)]. However, I had performed very well in XII, while most folks performed poorly as compared to their X. This time I had used guide books (besides NCERTs and reference books). And it worked! I was happy with the results because I used to estimate my marks rationally and not like how I used to do in X : KUCH KUCH LIKHA HAI TOH KUCH MARKS TO MIL HI JAANE CHAHIYE.
